title.narrative: Greater Mekong Subregion Biodiversity Conservation Corridors Project (Cambodia, Lao People's Democratic Republic, and Viet Nam)

description.narrative: The Project will enhance transboundary cooperation for preventing and mitigating fragmentation of biodiversity rich forest landscapes of the Cardamom Mountains and Eastern Plains Dry Forest in Cambodia, Triborder Forest areas located in southern Lao PDR, and the Central Annamites in Viet Nam.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry, Department of Forestry

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: The Project's outcome will be sustainably-managed biodiversity corridors in Cambodia, Lao PDR and Vietnam.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Management plans and Biodiversity Corridor policy with legal framework in place covering around 1.93 million ha of forest and non-forest land

description.narrative: The Project's outcome will be sustainably-managed biodiversity corridors in Cambodia, Lao PDR and Vietnam.

title.narrative: At least 30% of the commune and village corridor management committee members are women

description.narrative: The Project's outcome will be sustainably-managed biodiversity corridors in Cambodia, Lao PDR and Vietnam.

title.narrative: Increase in income and/or assets for target households by 40% in CAM & LAO, and 55% in VIE compared to 2011

description.narrative: The Project's outcome will be sustainably-managed biodiversity corridors in Cambodia, Lao PDR and Vietnam.

title.narrative: Biodiversity Conservation Corridors (BC) mapped and demarcated with cross-border arrangements entered into for maintenance and protection

description.narrative: The Project's outcome will be sustainably-managed biodiversity corridors in Cambodia, Lao PDR and Vietnam.
